item.title: R to @substack: packing the labels into an atlas so for each value of n there is a single draw call and single grid texture https://substack.net/wip/bz9.html

item.description:
packing the labels into an atlas so for each value of n there is a single draw call and single grid texture

item.title: R to @substack: lots of bugs and stability issues but published https://substack.net/wip/bz8.html#text=hello&padding=100,400,100,400 https://github.com/peermaps/qbzf
item.dc:creator: @substack
item.description:
lots of bugs and stability issues but published
substack.net/wip/bz8.html#te…
github.com/peermaps/qbzf

item.title: R to @ptrbyr: similar to dobbie but i'm only doing one raycast in +x and only for "fill". then i use a different calculation for distance to the curve for "stroke" and anti-aliasing. i pack many glyphs into one texture. pretty much the technique from this paper https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/research/wp-content/uploads/2008/08/NehHop08.pdf
item.dc:creator: @substack
item.description: similar to dobbie but i'm only doing one raycast in +x and only for "fill". then i use a different calculation for distance to the curve for "stroke" and anti-aliasing. i pack many glyphs into one texture. pretty much the technique from this paper microsoft.com/en-us/research…

item.title: R to @substack: anti-aliasing with solid stroke and fill
item.dc:creator: @substack
item.description: anti-aliasing with solid stroke and fill

item.title: R to @substack: and i can probably speed things up by writing curve intersections for rows + columns into the grid instead of looping over each grid cell to calculate intersections for rows * columns tests
item.dc:creator: @substack
item.description: and i can probably speed things up by writing curve intersections for rows + columns into the grid instead of looping over each grid cell to calculate intersections for rows * columns tests

item.title: R to @substack: everything works pretty well for stroke and fill now except for this letter t
item.dc:creator: @substack
item.description: everything works pretty well for stroke and fill now except for this letter t

item.title: R to @substack: spent about 2 days getting the coordinate remapping to work so the lookup texture would be as square as possible to pack more data in no matter what the grid geometry is like
item.dc:creator: @substack
item.description: spent about 2 days getting the coordinate remapping to work so the lookup texture would be as square as possible to pack more data in no matter what the grid geometry is like

item.title: R to @substack: i threw an extra pixel at the right supports for more precision and most of these horizontal lines went away but a few stubbornly remain at certain grid sizes
item.dc:creator: @substack
item.description: i threw an extra pixel at the right supports for more precision and most of these horizontal lines went away but a few stubbornly remain at certain grid sizes

item.title: R to @substack: i would rather live in a way where I don't have whatever problems a remote dev environment solves
item.dc:creator: @substack
item.description: i would rather live in a way where I don't have whatever problems a remote dev environment solves

item.title: R to @ceejbot: latency, lag, and dropped packets would be very frustrating to constantly deal with
item.dc:creator: @substack
item.description: latency, lag, and dropped packets would be very frustrating to constantly deal with

item.title: R to @polarest: yes, it's one shader to read from a grid texture of (curve_index, dx, dy) and a curve texture of (b0,b1,b2) quadratic bezier points to raycast against. most of the difficulty is in constructing those textures
item.dc:creator: @substack
item.description: yes, it's one shader to read from a grid texture of (curve_index, dx, dy) and a curve texture of (b0,b1,b2) quadratic bezier points to raycast against. most of the difficulty is in constructing those textures
